implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Main UI component that manages the state and orchestrates all task operations (add, edit, delete, mark as completed/pending) by calling API methods and rendering TaskForm and TaskItem components.
implementation.name: App
implementation.pseudo_code:
On mount:
    Call loadTasks to fetch all tasks from backend
On '+ Add Task' click:
    Open TaskForm for new task
On TaskForm submit:
    If editingTask is null:
        Call handleCreateTask (calls api.createTask)
    Else:
        Call handleUpdateTask (calls api.updateTask)
On delete button:
    Call handleDeleteTask (calls api.deleteTask)
On complete/pending toggle:
    Call handleToggleComplete (calls api.updateTask with toggled completed)
Render:
    TaskForm (for add/edit)
    List of TaskItem components for each task

missing_implementations: A new task must include a tag (the UI uses 'category' as tag, but it is not required and can be empty; the backend does not enforce presence of tag/category).

implementation.name: read_tasks
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to list all tasks (events). Called to display existing events to the user.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define GET /tasks endpoint
  Call get_tasks() from database
  Return list of tasks

implementation.name: create_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to add a new task (event). Called when a user submits the add event form.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define POST /tasks endpoint
  Accept TaskCreate payload
  Call add_task() in database
  Return created task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to edit an existing task (event). Called when a user submits the edit event form.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define PUT /tasks/{task_id} endpoint
  Accept TaskCreate payload
  Call update_task() in database
  If not found, raise 404
  Return updated task

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: API endpoint to delete an event. Called when a user requests to delete an event.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Define DELETE /tasks/{task_id} endpoint
  Call delete_task() in database
  If not found, raise error
  Return success

implementation.name: add_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Adds a new task (event) to the database. Called by the create_task endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Create new Task object with unique id and provided fields
Append to tasks list
Save tasks
Return new task

implementation.name: update_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Updates an existing task (event) in the database. Called by the update_task endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Find task by id
Replace with updated Task object
Save tasks
Return updated task or None

implementation.name: delete_task
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: Deletes a task (event) from the database. Called by the delete_task endpoint.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Get all tasks
Remove task with matching id
Save tasks
Return True if deleted, False otherwise

implementation.name: TaskForm
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: UI form for adding and editing events. Collects user input and calls backend endpoints.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Display form fields for title, description, priority, category, due date
On submit, call onSubmit with form data
On cancel, call onCancel

implementation.name: TaskItem
implementation.How_is_it_connected_to_implementation: UI component for displaying, editing, marking complete, and deleting events.
implementation.pseudo_code:
Display event details (title, description, priority, category, due date)
Show buttons for edit, delete, mark complete
Call appropriate handlers on button click

missing_implementations: A new event must include a location (no location field in backend or frontend).
A new event must include a description (description is optional, not required).
Ability to mark events as archived (no archive field or logic in backend or frontend).
Event uses 'title' instead of 'name' (minor naming mismatch).
Multiple tasks can be assigned to a single event.
